intro: Cheiloclinium parviflorum, commonly known as the small-flowered cheiloclinium, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are small, white or pale yellow, and clustered in dense inflorescences. The leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface.
